resources.string:
Special voor SIM hebben we een app gemaakt: Sensei City Runner 
Met de app kan je figuren in de stad lopen, die vervolgens worden weergegeven op de kaart. 
De City Runner app is niet alleen leuk, met je hardloop run genereer je Big Data en draagt bij aan wetenschappelijk onderzoek! 
Zo gaan de wetenschappers aan de Hogeschool van Amsterdam de geannonimeerde gegevens verder analyseren om nieuwe inzichten te ontwikkelen op het gebied van hardlopen in de stad.

Daarnaast kom je in delen van de stad waar je misschien nog nooit bent geweest. 

Of je hard of zacht loopt maakt niet uit, zolang het maar veilig en leuk is! 

Dus, trek je harloopschoenen aan en doe je zweetbandjes om!

Selecteer een track die dichtbij is 
Loop deze track uit 
en zie je figuur verschijnen! 
Deel je favoriete figuren om te laten zien dat jij de ultieme City Runner bent!
For our research we would like some user information. \nIf you are not comfortable with filling in the data, leave it blank.
If you are a student from the HvA and are participating in the Student In Motions -week \nFill in your team number.
Yes! Run finished! \nTake a look at your stats
View your route on http://sim.dmci.hva.nl \n(Your route is visible after +/- 5 minutes)
This app is based on OsmAnd http://osmand.net \nThis app is licensed under the LGPL v3 license http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html \nA copy of the source code can be provide when requested.
Thank you for using the SIM SENSEI City Runner app and enjoy running!

The SIM SENSEI City Runner app allows you to run figures in the city of Amsterdam. 
The City Runner app is developed by the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences (Hogeschool van Amsterdam), and a result of the collaboration between the Students in Motion project, the COMMIT research project SENSEI, the Amsterdam Centre of Expertise project Sense in the City and the CitySDK project. 
 
The City Runner app is part of a scientific study designed to help researchers analyse how you run and how you feel while running. 
The app logs movement and location data while you are running. Before and after a run it asks for your emotional state. 
Your data is saved under an anonymous account. 
 
More information about the app can be found at http://digitallifecentre.nl/projecten/sensei-sensor-based-engagement-for-improved-health?lang=en 
 
By using this application you consent to allowing your data to be used by researchers in order to improve recognition and coachig of sporting activities. 
 
Special thanks to Joost Broekens from the TUDelft for providing the AffectButton http://www.joostbroekens.com/ 
 
For storage of your data we use the CommonSense platform. On the CommonSense platform you can manage your own data and revoke the persmission to share your data with us. 
Please read the Sense-Os user agreement for more information http://www.sense-os.nl/user-agreement 
By using this application you agree with the Sense-Os terms of use.

The SIM SENSEI City Runner app allows you to run figures in the city of Amsterdam. 
The app is made for the Student in Motions week and part of a scientific study designed to help researchers to analyse how you run and how you feel while running. 
 
More information about Students in Motion can be found here 
More information about the research can be found here 
We use the AffectButton provided bij the TUDelft, more information about the AffectButton can be found here 
We use the CommonSense platform to store the scientific data, more information about Sense can be found here

To start running take the following steps: 
 
0. Plug in your headphone 
1. Select your neighbourhood 
2. Choose a route to run 
3. Give your current emotional state 
4. Put the phone in your pocket and run the route. (or walk if you are not into running) 
 Please keep your eyes on the road and not on your screen, the app will tell you where to run. 
5. When finished, give your new emotional state 
6. Finished! Go run some more, or admire your run on the CitySDK http://sim.dmci.hva.nl
Please navigate to the starting point before starting your run. \nAnd press the start button to start running!
Move within 300m distance of your starting point to begin. \nYou are currently
Now is a good time to plugin your headphone
Number of people you ran with?
Where did you put your phone?
